title: Partitioning-Guided K-Means: Extreme Empty Cluster Resolution for Extreme Model Compression. (arXiv:2306.14031v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Compactness in deep learning can be critical to a model's viability in low-resource applications, and a common approach to extreme model compression is quantization. We consider Iterative Product Quantization (iPQ) with Quant-Noise to be state-of-the-art in this area, but this quantization framework suffers from preventable inference quality degradation due to prevalent empty clusters. translated_title: 基于划分指导的k-means算法：极端模型压缩下的极端空簇解决方法
translated_abstract: 在深度学习中，紧凑性对于模型在低资源应用中的可用性至关重要，极端模型压缩的常见方法是量化。本文考虑迭代乘积量化（iPQ）与量化噪声是这一领域中的最新技术，但是这种量化框架由于存在空簇而导致推理质量下降，我们提出了几种新的增强方法，旨在通过解决空簇来提高iPQ与量化噪声的精确性。我们的贡献被称为基于划分指导的k-means算法（PG k-means），是由三个主要组成部分组成的高度增强的k-means实现。首先，我们提出了一种基于划分的预分配策略，确保没有初始空簇并鼓励均匀的权重分布。其次，我们提出了一种经验优越的空簇解决启发式算法，通过谨慎地分割大簇来执行。最后，我们限制了PG k-means的迭代总次数。
tldr: 本研究提出了一种名为PG k-means的算法，基于划分来解决空簇，提高了iPQ与量化噪声的精确性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a Partitioning-Guided k-means (PG k-means) algorithm to improve the accuracy of Iterative Product Quantization (iPQ) with Quant-Noise in extreme model compression, by resolving empty clusters through partitioning-based pre-assignment and empirical empty cluster resolution heuristics.
